Organic. Fairtrade. Fairtrade Breakfast. Wherever you are in the world, breakfast is considered the most important meal of the day. Our famers who grow the tea for our Organic Fairtrade Breakfast blend think so too. Working together we bring you a bright amber tea to give start to your day and a brighter future for them through Fairtrade. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing . It is said that 7 lucky number, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. Stephen Twining. 10th Generation. Tea traded in compliance with Fairtrade Standards. www.info.fairtrade.net Fairtrade means fairer trading conditions for Fairtrade producers in developing countries and opportunities for them to invest their businesses and communities for a sustainable future. Ethical Tea Partnership. We care about the communities where our tea is grown and picked and this is why we are founder member of the Ethical Tea Partnership, which works to improve tea workers' welfare and the environment in which they live. Twinings have also supported a range of projects since 2004, including improving health services and nutrition, providing access to clean water, better education and assisting children with disabilities. Together with our partners we have helped over a half a million children in China and India. To find out more about our projects visit www.twinings.co.uk

product.productName: Divine Fairtrade 70% dark chocolate with ginger & orange -
product.productDescription: Heavenly Chocolate with a heart. Dark Chocolate with orange granules and ginger flavour. Divine chocolate is made only with the finest quality Fairtrade cocoa beans from Kuapa Kokoo, a co-operative of smallholder farmers in Ghana. The cocoa is grown in the shade of the tropical rainforest, and slowly fermented and dried in the sun by the farmers, who take great pride in the chocolate company they co-own. Choosing delicious Divine gives you guaranteed pleasure, and the farmers a guaranteed fair deal, as well as the chance to invest in a better future - that's good business. Read the story of Divine on the inside of the wrapper, and visit: www.divinechocolate.com

product.productName: Divine Fairtrade 38% milk chocolate toffee & sea salt -
product.productDescription: Fairtrade. Owned by cocoa farmers - made for chocolate lovers. Kosher. Smooth, high cocoa milk chocolate, with a dash of sea salt perfectly counterpointing the sweet crunch of toffee. Divine Chocolate is made with the finest quality Fairtrade cocoa beans cultivated by the farmers of Kuapa Kokoo in Ghana, who take great pride in Divine, the company they co-own. Their cocoa is grown in the shade of the tropical rainforest, and slowly fermented and dried in the sun to bring out the full flavour that makes our chocolate Divine. You can read more about Divine inside this wrapper, and discover the full story, and the many delicious chocolate treats in the Divine range at: . www.divinechocolate.com. Visit www.info.fairtrade.net

Fairtrade. Fairtrade jam sugar. Tate&Lyle Sugars Cane Sugarhas more than 130 years of expertise in bringing the best sugars to your table. First produced in 1878, Tate&Lyle Sugars Cane Sugar has been produced at Tate&Lyle Sugars London refinery ever since. The company first became famous as a pioneer of the sugar cube. It is made from the natural juice of sugar cane which provides sweetness and enhances the flavour of your baking. There's plenty to smile about at www.tasteandsmile.co.uk as Tate&Lyle Sugars is now Fairtrade certified it gives consumers another reason to smile as it offers an ethical choice. Fairtrade Cane Sugar. The Fairtrade Certification Mark is your independent guarantee that the Fairtrade ingredients in this product have been certified in accordance with international Fairtrade Standards. www.info.fairtrade.net. Our Promise to Farmers: Tate&Lyle Sugars Fairtrade Cane Sugar helps to improve the lives of small scale farmers. Through your purchase you are helping to fund children's education and more sustainable farming for over 6000 farming families. To find out more please visit us at www.tasteandsmile.co.uk. TASTE + SMILE: There's plenty to smile about at www.tasteandsmile.co.uk. . Our Promise to the Environment: . Our sugar is made from the natural juice of sugar cane ripened by the sun, transported by ship and packed into recyclable bags. Find out more about our carbon footprint at www.tasteandsmile.co.uk

product.productName: Grumpy Mule Fair Trade Organic Sumatra coffee -
product.productDescription: Distinctive coffees. Fairtrade&Organic. Strength - 4. 100% arabica. Traceable, ethical and sustainable. Organic Sumatra ground coffee. A really smooth, full-bodied coffee with a chocolaty finish. Grumpy Mule coffees are sourced from farmers and co-operatives who are passionate about the quality of their coffee. What makes a truly great cup of coffee? Is it the aroma, flavour, freshness or something more than that? Here at Grumpy Mule we also get excited about the uniqueness, variety and seasonality that only quality Arabica coffees can provide and that's something we hope you'll share with us today. So, let the coffees speak for themselves. The Fairtrade-certified, KBQB Co-operative is based around the highlands of Takengon in the province of Aceh and has over 6000 small-holder members. This organically grown coffee is our best seller and makes a fantastic after-dinner coffee; perfect with or without milk. Fairtrade®&Organic coffees. Our Fairtrade®&Organic certified coffees are the heart and soul of the farming communities, where small-holder producers and their local co-operatives generate income for coffee families and help to support the wider community. Fairtrade®provides a better deal for producers in developing countries, creating opportunities for farmers and workers to improve their lives, their communities, provide education and to protect their environment (www.info.fairtrade.net). This partnership helps coffee growing communities to re-invest for the future, and by using organic, sustainable farming methods it ensures that the coffee is tended with great care and the quality of each harvest continues to develop. For more brewing information please visit us at www.grumpymule.co.uk

Sun-kissed legendary rice, nothing else. Grains of truth purity tested. Easy carry handle. Purity&quality guaranteed. Low to medium GI. Free from gluten and lactose. Free from added colours, preservatives and flavours. Tilda Legendary Rice is Pure Original Basmati: We select these unique, fragrant and delicate Basmati from over 10,000 independent farmers whom we know by name. Using methods handed down through generations they hand tend their crop in the Himalayan foothills - the only place on earth where basmati can be grown. Here the snow fed rivers, rich soil and unique climate, combine to give Tilda Basmati its tantalising flavour, delicate texture and magical aroma. Our Belief: We believe basmati is the finest rice in the world, that's why we are committed to guarding the quality and heritage of this legendary grain. For over 30 years our family business has been closely involved in supporting the basmati farming communities. At the heart of basmati is the farming community. We depend on it for our business and therefore work closely with the farmers to improve their community. Our Commitment: We only buy the best basmati and insist on an honest and fair partnership with farmers. Grains of Truth: We use state of the art DNA testing to check the purity of the basmati rice we buy, ensuring the unique characteristics of basmati - long slender grains with a delicate texture, delicious unique taste and tantalising aroma. Every grain is meticulously cleaned and milled with broken and discoloured grains removed. Why not try our range of 2-minute microwaveable Tilda Steamed Basmati recipe rices. Tilda is putting together a legendary rice recipe collections online. We want to hear from you if you have a legendary recipe passed down amongst your family. If we share your recipe online we will reward you with a year's worth of free Tilda Pure Basmati Rice (5 bags of 5kg). Send in your recipes online at recipes@tildacom or write to us at Tilda Ltd, Legendary Recipe Collections, PO Box 550, Rainham, RM13 9AE. For recipes and ideas visit: www.tilda.com

Fluffy&aromatic. A richer, more vibrant flavour. Basmati rice. The only element we have added is time... Not many people know Basmati improves with age. We have taken time to store every precious grain of this select 2006 harvest to create a richer, more vibrant flavour. Basmati relies on nature to mature and flourish, so every year's harvest is different. Our farmers recognise an exceptional crop when they see one and 2006 was one of the finest. When a harvest is this good, farmers like to keep some aside for their families to enjoy on special occasions. Fortunately for us, we have a limited number of special-edition packs to share with you. By storing this special Basmati for longer, then carefully milling it, we have achieved a richer, more separate grain, with an extraordinarily nutty aroma and naturally sweet flavour - perfect for that dinner party dish.

Use of high particle size to preserve the wholeness of the gluten;. Kneaded with cold water (under 15°C), that assures a sweeter taste and a better firmness during cooking;. Coarse bronze drawing, to give pasta the ideal roughness that makes it adhere perfectly to sauces.

Coarse bronze drawing, to give pasta the ideal roughness that makes it adhere perfectly to sauces.

Try adding some brown sugar, honey, orange juice and mustard to create a sumptuously sticky pork glaze. This marmalade is brought to you by Duerr\u2019s, the oldest family-owned jam maker in England. It all began over 130 years ago when Mary Duerr started making high quality fruit preserves in her home kitchen, and we have been committed to preserving tradition ever since. product.productName: The Meaningful Chocolate Company the real easter egg -
product.productDescription: Celebrate the real meaning of Easter. A life changing egg. Charity donation from every egg sold. Suitable for vegetarians. Here at the Meaningful Chocolate Company we have taken our luxury milk chocolate to create the perfect meaningful chocolate moment. But a meaningful chocolate moment is more than taste. Fairtrade®. All our chocolate is Fairtrade. Buying Fairtrade means fairer trading conditions and opportunities for producers in developing countries. As well as a fair price for their goods, Fairtrade farmers receive a premium payment to invest in improving their community, buying everything from schoolbooks and solar panels to providing fresh water supplies. We have also donated more than[125,000 from sales to charitable causes, development and education projects. You can read more at www.meaningfulchocolate.co.uk. So enjoy the moment - chocolate that tastes good and does good - chocolate that makes a big chunk of difference. The Real Meaning of Easter. Out of the 80 million Easter eggs sold in this part of the world every year, The Real Easter Egg is the only one that tells the Easter story and is also Fairtrade. Why we share eggs at Easter. 2000 years ago a man called Jesus brought a message of love to the world. Many people wanted to listen to his teachings but others wanted to get rid of him. Jesus was put to death on a cross on Good Friday. Three days later, on the Sunday, Jesus rose from the dead to meet his friends again. Today, billions of people all over the world believe that by dying and coming back to life, Jesus gave people a chance to know God in a new way. Friends of Jesus still follow him and know his love in their lives. Easter eggs are a reminder of this Good News. Eggs are a symbol of hope and new life. For some, eggs represent the stone that was rolled away from the tomb of Jesus. For more information visit. www.realeasteregg.co.uk. Charity Fighting Poverty. The real difference this egg will make... As well as paying farmers a premium through Fairtrade, we like to donate to charitable projects. So far we have helped raise more than[125,000. On this occasion a donation of 10p will be made to Traidcraft Exchange for every egg you buy. Traidcraft. Fighting poverty through trade. Traidcraft Exchange invests time and money in people, giving them the skills and confidence to work their own way out of poverty and become successful trading communities. Join us at www.traidcraft.co.uk/morethan just. Traidcraft Exchange - registered charity no. 1048752

product.productName: Littleover Apiary wildflower honey with royal jelly -
product.productDescription: Organic. Organic wildflower honey with royal jelly. All of our honey is cold extracted and cold filtered to protect the natural proteins and enzymes in this most natural of products. The hives are managed in time honoured ways the way its been done for generations. They are placed in areas of prolific flowering plants in order to achieve this mild yet excitingly flavoured honey, which is extracted straight from the comb to keep all of its subtle aromas and tastes intact. We then add Royal Jelly one of natures wonders this is to increase even this honeys natural health promoting properties. Littleover Apiaries are committed to sustainable farming and the care of our planet whilst producing this premium honey.

Made by nature in New Zealand. Manuka honey with anti-bacterial properties. Activity: The rating refers to the measure of the unique antibacterial activity present in Manuka Honey, as tested by an independent laboratory. Steens Uniqueness: Our unique cold process extraction ensures the natural pollens, enzymes and antibacterial properties are retained in our honey. We control product quality from the hive to the pot, filtering out large particles of wax then the rest is yours, just as nature intended. Our honey is raw and will form a natural crystal. Steens is dedicated to people who care deeply about the natural health and wellbeing of their families and themselves. Quality, Sustainability, Ethics&Wellbeing. Find out more at www.steensnewzealand.com. Beekeeper Carlos Zevallos. Go to our website to say thanks to Carlos. www.steensnewzealand.com. Good honey, good health. Part of the proceeds from every pot of honey you enjoy supports environmental projects and charities around the world.

Organic. Pure organic 'wildflower' set honey. All of our honey is cold extracted, cold filtered and unblended to protect the natural proteins and enzymes in this premium honey. Our hives are carefully sited in organic registered 'wild flower' meadows during the spring and summer months. This is to ensure that our bees are in the best possible positions to gather their organic harvest of pollen and nectar to produce the perfect natural honey.

Great Taste awards - Bronze. Pure English honey. All of our honey is cold extracted, cold filtered and unblended to protect the natural proteins and enzymes that make honey a super food. This summer honey is produced from shires of rural England during the time when the honey flow is at its peak and the bees are busiest. The hive has its highest population now and is really buzzing, this ensures the bees are in the best possible condition to produce this premium pure English honey from their harvest of nectar. This honey is sweeter and has a slightly more robust flavour. Great for drinks or sweetening your breakfast or wonderful spread on a fresh bread roll.

Absolutely nothing artificial. Baked oat clusters - crunchy to the last bite. No added salt. High in fibre. Conservation grade - nature friendly farming®. No artificial flavourings, colourings or preservatives. Non-GM. Suitable for vegetarians. Crisp cereal clusters with freeze dried strawberries. Every mouthful of delicious Jordans Country Crisp not only taste amazing, it also helps to create homes for wildlife in our beautiful British countryside. Jordans Good Food Commitment. At Jordans we use British wholegrain cereals and keep processing to an absolute minimum. Salt is never added and we're committed to reducing sugar and fat levels ongoing without compromising on great taste. What's more, we use only natural ingredients where we can. You'll never find artificial flavourings, colourings or preservatives in any Jordans products, nor do we ever add sulphur dioxide as a preservative for our cereals, so you can enjoy every delicious mouthful! Jordans Countryside Commitment. At Jordans we are passionate about making great tasting cereals, but we are also passionate about maintaining our beautiful British countryside. Jordans cereals are grown to Conservation Grade\u2122 standards which means they come from British farmers who manage 10% of their land so that birds, bees and butterflies can thrive and ourcountryside can be kept buzzing and beautiful. When you buy products with the Conservation Grade\u2122 logo, you can rest assured that you are doing your bit to help keep our countryside flourishing. Keep the Countryside flourishing. Britain's countryside is in trouble. We've all experienced our wonderful British countryside on a summer's day, however did you know that the number of herb-rich meadows has dramatically declined over the years, which along with fewer hedgerows means there aren't enough places for wildlife to make their homes? If we lose pollinators, it will impact the food chain, meaning less in the way of flowers, berries and crops for us all to enjoy. Hedgerow homes. Jordans is the only cereal company which insists its farmers dedicate land specifically to create homes for wildlife. All the farmers who grow grain for Jordans use 10% of their land just so that British wildlife like the Brown Hairstreak butterfly can have a home. We've invested in this for over 25 years and your support in buying Jordans has really helped... but we can still do more. Join in... grow your own. product.productName: Eat Natural Toasted Muesli With Nuts & Seeds -
product.productDescription: High in fibre. Whole grain oats. 25% nuts and seeds. Fruit free. Low in salt. No artificial flavours or colours and no preservatives. Suitable for vegetarians. A mix of sunflower seeds, pumpkin seeds and linseeds with toasted ryecrumbs, oats, coconut, almonds and hazelnuts...and nothing dodgy. So..what's in it for you? This toasted breakfast cereal is packed with loads of tasty, good wholesome stuff. Here's just a few of the wonderful bits and bobs you'll find inside... Almonds. Our Californian almonds are selected for their sweet taste, then roasted to perfection. Seeds. Our special toasted blend of delicious mixed seeds makes up a fifth of this muesli recipe. We use nutty sunflower seeds, crunchy pumpkin seeds and golden linseeds. Coconut. Enormous shreds of crisp, toasted coconut bring a little bit of tropical indulgence. Hazelnuts. Sweet, small and succulent, our hazelnuts are lightly roasted in our very own""Fruit and Nut Spa""at the Eat Natural Makery to enhance their crunchiness. Down here at the Eat Natural Makery, when we say""natural', what exactly do we mean? Well, clearly it would be wrong of us to claim that everything in this muesli is '100% natural' - ryecrumbs, crisped rice and rapeseed oil simply doesn't grow on trees. Obviously, everything needs to be cleaned, dried and roasted too, and therefore, to some extent, 'processed'. It's just that we believe, the less we mess with it...the better it tastes, and why we will never, every add any dodgy stuff. That means, no artificial flavours or colours and no preservatives. What goes into every bowl? A straightforward approach to everything we do. A little bit of extra love and care in every recipe created. The best tasting ingredients sourced from exactly the right growers. Perfectly mixed small batches of just what you want...and nothing dodgy. Simple...isn't it? Find us on Facebook. Twitter

product.productName: Eat Natural brazils & sultanas breakfast cereal -
product.productDescription: High fibre. Whole grain oats. Over 25% fruits&nuts. Light&crispy spelt flakes. Low in salt. No artificial flavours or colours and no preservatives. Suitable for vegetarians. Whole roasted oats and toasted flakes of spelt with juicy raisins and sultanas, brazil nuts, pumpkin seeds and honey ...and nothing dodgy. What goes into every bowl? A straightforward approach to everything we do. A little bit of extra love and care in every recipe created. The best tasting ingredients sourced from exactly the right growers. Perfectly mixed small batches of just what you want ...and nothing dodgy. Simple...isn't it? So...what's in it for you? This toasted breakfast cereal is packed with loads of tasty, good wholesome stuff. Here's just a few of the wonderful bits and bobs you'll find inside... Brazil Nuts. Our huge pieces of deliciously sweet brazil nut are gently roasted to give them extra crunch. Raisins and Sultanas. We're ever so proud of our wonderfully plump and extremely juicy jumbo raisins and sultanas. Our raisins are made by sun-drying the deliciously sweet 'Flame' variety of red grapes, from Chile. Oats. Our specially selected whole grain oats have been chosen for their larger and juicer grains. When rolled and roasted, this gives them a much lighter, crispier texture and a nuttier taste. Spelt. Our light and crispy spelt flakes are a great way 'fuel up' for the day ahead. Spelt is a great alternative to wheat and is much easier to digest than other cereals. Down here at the Eat Natural Makery, when we say""natural', what exactly do we mean? Well, clearly it would be wrong of us to claim that everything in this muesli is '100% natural' - spelt flakes and rapeseed oil simply don't grow on trees. Obviously, everything needs to be cleaned, dried and roasted too, and therefore, to some extent, 'processed'. It's just that we believe, the less we mess with it...the better it tastes, and why we will never, ever add any dodgy stuff. That means, no artificial flavours or colours and no preservatives. Simple...isn't it? Find us on facebook. Twitter

These carefully selected grains are then lovingly nurtured through a few simple steps to the delicious golden flakes that brighten up your breakfast bowl. Simple Steps. Our Crispy and Crunchy Flakes of Corn are lightly toasted for a delicious taste. Each organic corn flake is not only tasty but a low fat, low saturates and naturally gluten free food. Our flakes are so delightfully golden, you'll be beaming all morning! The Whole Earth Story began in 1967 when Craig Sams and his brother Gregory opened Seed, a pioneering vegetarian, organic and macrobiotic restaurant in Paddington, London. His pioneering spirit continues with the team today and we soon realised that many of our devoted customers were as passionate about organic food as we were and wanted to buy our products. And so 'Ceres Grain' was founded, the first of a new generation of natural food stores, which sold Whole Earth products and baked goods. In 1974 we launched a range of organic cereals and we made the first organic corn flakes in the UK. We wanted to have an organic alternative to this popular breakfast cereal so in 1991, Whole Earth launched the first ever organic corn flakes to be sold in the UK. The delicious flakes of corn are lightly toasted to produce a crisp and crunchy flake. They are a low fat, low saturates and naturally gluten free food, so feel free to indulge yourself. We use only the finest ingredients. We're happy to say that 100% of our agricultural ingredients were produced in accordance with the rules of organic production. CarbonNeutral®company. Being Carbon Neutral. Almost everything we do, from travelling to work in the morning to watching TV at night, produces carbon dioxide (C02) - the major greenhouse gas. At Whole Earth we believe that if we are taking from the environment in order to produce organic food products, then we need to give back too. We invest in environmental projects to balance out the global warming gases our company offices generate and as a result we have been given CarbonNeutral status by The CarbonNeutral Company. For more info: Please go to www.wholeearthfoods.com. Why Organic? Learn more about organic food and farming or how to support the work of the Soil Association at: . http://www.soilassociation.org. ''Laughter is brightest where food is best'' Irish Proverb.

40% Less Sugar than the leading diet cereal brand. Over 70% Wholegrain. No artificial colours, flavours of preservatives. Light crisp pillows of oat cereal. Nature's way to lower cholesterol. Oats are one of the natural ways to help lower cholesterol, as part of a diet low in saturated fat and a healthy lifestyle. By the time we are 35, one in 2 of us has high cholesterol. Oats contain a soluble fibre (something the boffins call bet-glucan) which soaks up cholesterol. Reducing your cholesterol can help to maintain a healthy heart. Oats are a delicious source of wholegrain goodness... and we at Quaker are passionate about getting them absolutely perfect! We have been milling oats since 1899. We are proud to say that our mill in Cupar, Scotland uses electricity from renewable energy sources.

Organic. Gluten free. Low fat. Fibre rich. Vegetarian Society approved. Gluten free cereal flakes made with a rice and buckwheat grain blend. Kick start your day with these light, crispy, sustaining cereal flakes. They are made with rice and buckwheat (no relation to ordinary wheat) and are surprisingly low in fat. Grains are complex carbohydrates which your body uses to generate energy. 'I'm an organic farmer and, like colleagues in other countries, follow international organic rules. We rotate crops, grassland and livestock to develop natural soil fertility&create habitats for wildlife conservation. Rice is the staple for nearly half the world's population and is grown on every continent. Long and short grain varieties grow in conditions ranging from flooded paddy fields to dry uplands. Italy is the rice basket of Europe and the source of our rice, where it is grown by dedicated organic farmers. The triangular dark brown buckwheat seed is a member of the rhubarb family and is unconnected to wheat. It grows to a metre in height, producing small pink to white flowers in late summer. Sometimes known as sarasin, buckwheat has a distinctive sweet flavour and is naturally gluten free. I hope that you will enjoy these cereal flakes. We have avoided hydrogenated fat to make a great tasting breakfast that is ideal for wheat and gluten free diets.'. Michael Marriage. At Doves Farm we make biscuits, cookies and a large range of bread, cake and speciality flours.

An easygoing, aromatic blend created to enjoy over a lazy weekend brunch, but beautifully smooth any day of the week. Its harmonious combination of Central American and African beans is so mild and moreish you can enjoy cup after cup - perfect for getting you through the Sunday papers. Our Family Business. At Taylors of Harrogate, we're proud to bring together the best of our old and new generations. Our coffee range includes heritage recipes devised by our earliest coffee buyers, and innovative blends that reflect our more recent discoveries. Our Family of Flavours. If you enjoy the smooth flavours of Lazy Sunday, we recommend you also try CaféImperial, or Guatemala Cloud Forests from our speciality range. We Trade Fairly. All of the coffee we buy comes from independently certified farms and co-operatives. Over the years we've developed long-lasting, sustainable relationships with our coffee growers by regularly visiting them and always paying fair prices. Now, by collaborating with independent certifying bodies, we're able to make a difference on the ground much more quickly and effectively. That's why we've helped our existing suppliers to achieve independent certification from the scheme that suits them best. Explore and learn more about our coffees www.taylorscoffee.co.uk. Duerr\u2019s strawberry jam. A scrumptious classic breakfast preserve. Also ideal for a wide range of baking applications. Keeps for up to 6 weeks after opening. Gluten free and suitable for vegetarians&vegans. Duerr\u2019s strawberry jam is a deliciously classic preserve, made using only the best fruit for a real taste of summer. As English as the Queen and bowler hats, it\u2019s perfect for a wide range of tasty breakfast, baking and snack ideas, helping to bring some sweetness to your table. For fantastic jam tarts, line a greased cupcake tin with pastry, fill with strawberry jam and bake until the jam is gooey and simply irresistible. This jam is brought to you by Duerr\u2019s, the oldest family-owned jam maker in England. It all began over 130 years ago when Mary Duerr started making high quality fruit preserves in her home kitchen, and we have been committed to preserving tradition ever since. Why not try our wide range of jams, spreads and other condiments, for more delicious Duerr\u2019s quality?

CaféPod Intense Espresso has a rich, heavy body and intense flavour. Fine quality Arabicas from Southern Brazil and Central America develop flavours of dark chocolate and chestnut when given a fuller roast in our traditional drum roaster. These coffees, combined with the finest Southern Indian Robustas, renowned for their full body and spicy finish, create a powerful and bold coffee that lingers with a sweet, smoky finish on the palate. Passionate about coffee. Our Master Roasters have sourced the finest beans from coffee regions around the world in order to create the best espresso for you to enjoy. Each batch has been carefully selected, roasted and ground to perfection. All CaféPod capsules are sealed individually to maximise freshness, ensuring you enjoy your favourite blend at home as our Master Roasters intended. By Appointment to HRH The Prince of Wales Suppliers of Beverages, Taylors of Harrogate North Yorkshire. Rainforest Alliance Certified. Minimum 30% Certified Content. We're working with the Rainforest Alliance because they care about the things that have always mattered to us: that the farmers and their families are treated with respect, that their tea is grown sustainably and the environment is well looked after. www.rainforest-alliance.org. Something to read while the kettle's boiling... Blended to suit your water. If you live in a hard water area, it really affects the taste of your tea. That's why we make this special blend of teas that work brilliantly in hard water - and we're the only tea company who does this. Did you know? To find the best teas, our blenders taste hundreds of teas from around the world every single day. We care about trees. Twenty years ago, our chairman promised his children he'd find a way to plant a million trees. We asked you to help us, and together we've managed to plant over three million trees around the world. Now we've saving the rainforest. Deforestation is a major cause of climate change. That's why we've set out to save an area of rainforest the size of Yorkshire. To find out more about our Yorkshire Rainforest Project, visit yorkshiretea.co.uk. For every box of Yorkshire Tea sold, we pledge to save a tree. Help us save the rainforest. Buy this tea and you'll save a tree. Simple. But you can do more by collecting these tokens. For every four you save, 50p goes to the Yorkshire Rainforest Project. Send your tokens to Yorkshire Tea, Admail 819, Harrogate HG1 1AZ. Friends of Yorkshire Tea. We get so many letters from people who love our tea, we decided to set up a little group on our website. product.productName: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire decaffeinated tea bags 80 -
product.productDescription: Tea bags. Taste worth waiting for. Perfectionists that we are, we put a lot of time into developing our blends - but the time we spent thinking about our Decaf really took the biscuit. That's because we simply refused to compromise on taste. Tea is delicate, so it can really lose its flavour when it's decaffeinated. But it didn't seem fair that cutting down on caffeine meant missing out on a proper brew. So, after a lot of thought, we decided to do something about it. Luckily for us, Ian, our Head of Tea, loves a challenge. Working closely with our suppliers, Ian and his team tasted literally thousands of different teas to find ones that didn't lose their flavour during decaffeination. In fact, over a year of trial and error went by before they hit upon exactly the right combination of top quality East African teas. The result is a satisfying decaf that gives you all the colour and flavour you'd expect from Yorkshire tea. We hope you'll agree it was worth the wait! Friends of Yorkshire Tea. We get so many letters from people who love our tea, we decided to set up a little group on our website. If you'd like to join, take a look. www.yorkshiretea.co.uk. Yorkshire Tea Gifts. Like tea growing, tea blending is an art. We blend the finest Ugandan and Tanzanian leaves to give our tea its body distinctive rosy colour. Organic. Pure teas - no compromise. Organic Skinny Dragon Pu'er Tea. Pu'er is one of China's most illustrious and intriguing teas. Since the Tang Dynasty it has been prized for both its distinctive, earthy taste and its reputed health benefits. Grown and made in Yunnan province using secret techniques, Pu'er tea was traded on the ancient Tea Caravan route which led into the towering Tibetan mountains. Particularly enjoyed after a heavy meal, in Chinese tradition Pu'er is said to bring the digestive system into balance. Taste: an intriguing full-bodied earthy taste with a slight sweetness. We think of our bar range as an important cornerstone of what we are and what we do. At our creative core is passion for innovation in chocolate and that should shine through in something as apparently simple as a chocolate bar. Nothing is ordinary in this range, from selecting the finest cocoa to the detail and care in combining challenging ingredients. Since our foundation in 2000, we have maintained and improved our founding principles we coin as 'Trading Fairly' which extends not only to how we purchase our cocoa but also our packaging and how we influence and impact all our partners. We are passionate about our impact on the small planet we live and trade with and this colours much of what we do and how we do it. Please pop along to our website to find out more.

Organic. Gluten free. Vegetarian Society approved. Suitable for coeliacs. Gluten free corn flakes. Wake up to a bowl of golden flakes grown on warm days under the Italian sun. We add malted rice syrup to create delicious organic crunchy corn flakes, a low-fat, organic choice for breakfast or any other time of the day. At Doves Farm we make biscuits, cookies, cereal bars and a large range of bread, cake and speciality flours. 'I'm an organic farmer and, like colleagues in other countries, follow international organic rules. We rotate crops, grassland and livestock to develop natural soil fertility&create habitats for wildlife conservation. Globally we produce 600 million tonnes of maize each year, outstripping world production of wheat or rice. Maize, also known as corn, can be canned, popped, ground and flaked. Modern agricultural practices have controversially developed genetically modified strains and dramatically reduced the number of varieties. Organic standards do not permit genetic engineering. Thanks to the international Slow Food movement, Central American communities are being encouraged to grow and protect their ancient maize varieties. This important conservation work is creating a seed bank for future generations. I hope that you will enjoy these delicious golden flakes of corn. We have avoided sugar, dairy, soya and hydrogenated fats to make a delicious cereal which is also great for those on gluten free diets.'. Michael Marriage

Creative Chocolate from Britain. Made with Imagination and Love. ""This is no ordinary chocolate. The quality of the organic beans from our friends in the Dominican Republic don't just shine through it almost burns a hole in the carton! You get a full and balanced flavour without any overpowering bitterness. Don't judge chocolate by cocoa content, judge it by flavour and consider the beans, climate, soil, weather and about another zillion things more important than the number."". Helen Pattinson, Co-founder. We think of our bar range as an important cornerstone of what we are and what we do. At our creative core is a passion for innovation in chocolate and that should shine through in something as apparently simple as a chocolate bar. Nothing is ordinary in this range, from selecting the finest cocoa to the detail and care in combining challenging ingredients. Since our foundation in 2000, we have maintained and improved our founding principles we coin as 'Trading Fairly' which extends not only to how we purchase our cocoa but also our packaging and how we influence all our partners. We are passionate about our impact on the small planet we live and trade with and this colours much of what we do and how we do it. Please pop along to our website to find out more. 100% NATURAL. At Ebly®, we carefully pre-cook the wheat to preserve its natural nutrients to bring you the benefits of a high fibre and balanced diet. Highly versatile to use, Ebly®can be boiled, baked in casseroles, steamed or fried in no more than 10 minutes. It absorbs cooking sauces to combine its nutty flavour and distinctive""al dente""bite. Ebly®is harvested exclusively from wheat grown in central France to ensure that it is 100% natural and free from additives, preservatives and colourings. Because we believe natural foods direct to you from""mother nature""are vital for your wellbeing.

Organic. Delicious as a rice substitute. Great for risottos&soups. High fibre. British grown spelt. Soil Association Organic Food Awards 2012 - Highly Commended. Vegetarian Society approved. Organic pearled spelt. What is Spelt? Spelt is an ancient grain that has been grown in Somerset since the start of the Iron Age. It's a cross between emmer wheat and goats grass, with a delicious nutty taste, and is different to common wheat in that the body finds it easier to digest. This is due to its unique brittle gluten structure, which means some people with a wheat intolerance may find spelt a suitable alternative (please note: spelt contains gluten and is not suitable for diagnosed coeliacs). The History of Sharpham Park. For well over 1,000 years, Sharpham Park has had a rich agricultural heritage, sustaining Abbots, Kings and Noblemen. The spelt fields have 6 metre margins and the hedgerows are only cut every other year, allowing wildlife such as hare, lapwing, dormice, bees and ladybirds to shelter and forage for food all year round. And we are proud to say that this pearled spelt is fully organic, which means no pesticides, herbicides or harmful chemicals were used in the production process. In partnership with... Bowel Cancer UK. Save lives. To donate www.bowelcanceruk.org.uk. Registered charity number (England and Wales) 1071038 Scottish charity number SC040914. Kilver Court Designer Village. Visit Kilver Court in Somerset, where you'll find the entire range our delicious Sharpham park spelt produce. Kilver Court is a Designer Village housed in a regenerated Victorian textile mill, surrounded by award winning gardens and offering fabulous local and organic food from the Harlequin Café. Designer outlets include Mulberry, Aubin&Wills, Toast LK Bennett, Jack Wills, Jane Clayton and much more... Visit www.kilvercourt.com for the full story. Visit our website www.sharphampark.com. For loads of recipes using our spelt, details on the Wyvern Club for children, and for more info on the Kilver Court Designer Village, the farmshop, caféand gardens... and much more. Follow sharpham park on facebook and twitter

Great taste gold 2010. Delicious&nutritious! Source of zinc&calcium. A good source of iron. A rich source of fibre per 30g 8.7g. High in omega 3 fatty acids. Nurture by nature. Healthy super foods. No added sugar - contains naturally occurring sugars. Gluten, dairy, yeast and GMO free. Suitable for coeliacs. Suitable for vegetarian&vegan diets. Our nutritionally dense flaxseed supports a balanced diet and active lifestyle. Our Flaxseed is grown in Canada and is cold milled to protect all the nutritional goodness and Omega oils contained in the seed. Flaxseed also known as Linseed, is one of nature's richest sources of the essential fatty acid Omega 3 (ALA). Our body does not naturally produce Omega 3 therefore we must get this valuable fatty acid from our food, and Flaxseed provides an easy, convenient and tasty source with 7.2g of Omega 3 per 30g. Health Benefits Include: Omega 3 (ALA) - Essential fatty acid which contributes to the maintenance of normal blood cholesterol levels. Protein - Contributes to the growth and maintenance of muscle mass and the maintenance of normal bones. Iron - Important for oxygen transport in the body and the formation of red blood cells. Zinc - Necessary for immune system function and antioxidant protection of body cells and tissues from oxidative stress. Calcium - Needed for the maintenance of normal bones and teeth. At Linwoods we sourceonly the finest quality seeds, nuts and berries from around the world to produce our natural, tasty and nutritious healthy super foods. Our healthy super foods are cold milled to aid quick and easy absorption into the body, so you can feel the immediate nutritional benefit in your diet, naturally. Try our tasty recipe ideas. For more info go to: www.linwoodshealthfoods.com or visit our facebook page @ linwoods super foods.

HEINZ BAKED BEANS IN CURRY SAUCE.

Organic. Gluten free. Non GM. Low fat less than 3% fat. Suitable for vegans. Baked beans in a rich tomato sauce naturally sweetened by organic agave syrup. Agave syrup (also called agave nectar) is a sweetener commercially produced in Mexico, from several agave species. To product agave nectar, juice is expressed from the core of the agave. The juice is filtered, then heated, to hydrolyse carbohydrates into sugars. The filtered, hydrolysed juice is concentrated to a syrup-like liquid a little thinner than honey and ranges in colour from light to dark.

product.productName: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire leaf tea -
product.productDescription: Rainforest Alliance certified. Bringing you a proper brew. We go to great lengths to make tea properly - from tasting 1000s of teas a day to find the best for our blend, to thinking about the water you'll brew it with at home. And over the years, we've built relationships with some of the world's top tea estates and gardens, visiting them in person as much as possible. But working closely with our suppliers is about more than quality tea. It's about trading with a conscience, doing business in a way that respects people and planet. By Appointment to HRH The Prince of Wales Suppliers of Beverages, Taylors of Harrogate North Yorkshire. Find out more at www.yorkshiretea.co.uk. We are a member of Ethical Tea Partnership. Rainforest Alliance Certified\u2122. Minimum 70% Certified Tea. This product includes teas from Rainforest Alliance Certified\u2122 farms. For more information, visit www.rainforest-alliance.org. Help us to save the rainforest. Help us to save a Yorkshire-sized area of rainforest by collecting these token. For every four you save, 50p goes to our Yorkshire Rainforest Project. Send your tokens to: Yorkshire Tea,. Admail 819,. Harrogate,. HG1 1AZ. How do you brew? What's best - a pot or a mug? A stir or squeeze? Milk in first or last? Find us on Facebook and let us know!

Large leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. The hot and humid climate of the Assam Valley in North India produces a tea noted for its deep colour and rich flavour, which has just a hint of malt.

Carefully selected teas from Kenya, India and Rwanda blended for a smooth, rich and refreshing flavour. The teas we use are specially selected from the best tea growing areas of the world, each having a distinctive character and flavour. Whilst the quality of our tea is important, the welfare of the people growing it for us is equally so. We have developed long term relationships with our tea growers to ensure that Waitrose offers the highest quality product.

STRONG&MALTY. A DEEP AMBER TEA WITH A RICH AND MALTY CHARACTER. ELEPHANTS ARE A BIG PART OF EVERYDAY LIFE IN INDIA... Just like tea. And although elephants aren't known for their tea drinking, in the tea-growing region of Assam they help out by doing a lot of the heavy lifting and carrying. We always think hard work deserves a cup of Assam. So sit back and think of elephants while enjoying this deep amber tea. It goes perfectly with brunch, or as an after-dinner alternative to coffee. If you like your tea to pack a strong punch, we think you'll also like Twinings Lapsang Souchong and Twinings 1706. Discover something new with Twinings. TEA, TWININGS&INSPIRATION. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark an idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man who loved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until they're just right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop on London's Strand, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org. Working for a responsible tea industry.

Fully Rainforest Alliance certified tea. Free the fresh taste. We pick the top two leaves and the bud known as the tips - hence the name - and that's what makes PG tips so good. Rainforest Alliance Certified\u2122. We're proud to say our tea is now fully Rainforest Alliance certified. So when you choose PG tips, you're helping us help our environment, our farmers, and their families. Find out more at: www.rainforest-alliance.org. It'salways time for PG tips. Drink up with friends. Catch up with someone special. And keep up with me, on... Facebook. Do your bit and recycle with us! Find out more at www.pgtips.co.uk

Large leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Tea from the Himalayan foothills, where the slow growth of the tea bushes results in the famous Darjeeling flavour: delicate and highly distinctive.

Large leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Kenya tea is grown in the highlands either side of the Rift Valley and is noted for its bright golden colour and brisk and refreshing flavour.

Blended to produce an exceptionally rich full flavoured tea. This vital strength and colour comes from specifically selected teas, which can only be picked during one short season of the year. Despite the scarcity of these teas, the exclusive flavour of Lyons Red Label never varies.

Makes a lovely cup of tea. Rainforest Alliance Certified. Yorkshire Leaf Tea. Hurrah for the teapot! If you enjoy your tea made properly in a teapot you'll really appreciate the lovely taste of Yorkshire Tea. If you live in a hard water area, it really affects the taste of your tea. That's why we make this special blend of teas that work brilliantly in hard water - and we're the only company that does this. We're saving the rainforest. Deforestation is a major cause of climate change so we're on a mission to save an area of rainforest the size of Yorkshire. You can help by collecting our rainforest tokens. For every four you save we'll donate 50p to the Yorkshire Rainforest Project. Send your tokens to Yorkshire Tea, Admail 819, Harrogate HGI IAZ. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org. working for a responsible tea industry. RAINFOREST ALLIANCE CERTIFIED. Minimum 30% Certified Content. We're working with the Rainforest Alliance because they care about the things that have always mattered to us: that the farmers and their families are treated with respect, that their tea is growing sustainably and the environment is well looked after. www.rainforest-alliance.org. If you'd like to know more about Yorkshire Tea visit our website at yorkshiretea.co.uk

BRIGHT&UPLIFTING. A COPPER COLOURED TEA WITH A BRISK, REFRESHING FLAVOUR. TEA, TWININGS&INSPIRATION. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark an idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop on London's Strand. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man who loved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until they arejust right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop on London's Strand, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. IT WAS TOO LONG TO WAIT BETWEEN LUNCH AND DINNER... For Anna Maria, Duhess of Bedford back in the 1840's. She got so peckish one afternoon that she decided some toast and jam, served with a pot of tea would be a good idea. The trend caught on, and pretty soon afternoon tea had become an important part of the British day. Our Traditional Afternoon tea goes perfectly with sandwiches or cake, and is just right for when you need a little afternoon boost. If you like light traditional style tea, we think you'll also like Twinings Ceylon, Teinings Rooibos and Twinings African Honeybush&Lemon. Discover something new with Twinings. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org working for a responsible tea industry.

Large leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Blended from teas grown in the famous Dimbula and Uva districts, this tea is light in colour with a clean smooth flavour and subtle fragrance.

Great taste gold 2010. Sweet chilli&red pepper seasoned potato crisps. Nothing teases the taste buds quite like this subtly bracing coalition of sweet chilli and red pepper. Just a few quick potato-shaped words to kick things off. We're Tyrrells and we make fine English crisps here on our farm in Herefordshire. We cook them by hand in small batches and we always leave the jackets on. We reckon they're rather special, but don't take our word for it - dig in and let us know what you think. And if you like these, keep your eyes peeled for our magnificent vegetable crisps. English Eccentrics. Whether it's the great uncle who organised dinner parties for dogs, or the grandmother who lived in an underground mansion filled with wigs - we love an English eccentric. Do you have a friend or relative with habits that are, how shall we say, a little unconventional? If so, regale us with a story about them and if it's suitably gigglesome, we'll publish it on our fully-digital internet site and furnish you with some freebies. Just saunter over to www. tyrrellscrisps.co.uk/eccentrics. For the chance to win one of 100 cases of our crisps every month, just sign up to become an Official Taste Tester on our internet website thingy: www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk. The Tyrrells Alternative Five-A-Day. Steamed broccoli, herbal tea, sit-ups: nothing terribly wrong with any of those (in moderation). But there a such thing as taking it too far, you know. Which is why we came up with our own lifestyle guide, an alternative five-a-day. It's a simple list of things to keep your spirits up. Well, it works for us! A chunk of stilton. A hot toddy. A little lie down. A pint of bitter. A well-deserved bag of proper English crisps. Tell us your alternative five-a-day at www.tyrrellscrisps.co.uk and if we love it we'll pop it on our website and give you a little pressie.

Perfect with a slice of buttery toast or a full English. Original English breakfast tea bags. Our English Breakfast master blender searches relentlessly for the best teas from Assam, Ceylon and Kenya to give a perfectly balanced blend. We don't stop at just one tea from each origin, as each specially chosen tea garden adds a defining taste and quality to the end blend. Every cup you drink contains tea from 15 different tea gardens. The master blender has a busy task, the large number of tea gardens and seasonal fluctuations mean for every batch they juggle the levels of each tea in the recipe to give a consistently first class cup of tea. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing. It is said that 7 is a lucky number, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that the quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. Ethical Tea Partnership. We care about the communities where our tea is grown and picked and this is why we are a founder member of the Ethical Tea Partnership, which works to improve tea workers' welfare and the environment in which they live. Twinings have also supported a range of projects since 2004, including improving health services and nutrition, providing access to clean water, better education and assisting children with disabilities. Together with our partners we have helped over half a million children in China and India. To find out more about our projects visit www.twinings.co.uk. What's your favorite breakfast? For many people it's bacon and eggs, with a slice or two of buttery toast. Not as essential, though, as a good cup of tea. This original blend is the perfect start to the day. They say breakfast's the most important meal. We say this tea's the most important drink. As the Original English Breakfast it carries Stephen Twinings' signature, still working at Twinings, just as his ancestors did many years ago.

Perfect with a slice of buttery toast or a full English. English breakfast tea. A hearty breakfast is a necessity on these cold mornings and no breakfast is complete without a steamy mug of tea. However, making someone a deliciously hot cup of Twinings English Breakfast can help them to feel the world is better place to be, at any time of day or night. So, why not share this special gift of tea and bestow some Twinings English Breakfast upon your friends and family?

Small leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Rich flavoured assam teas have been combined with bright golden teas from the highlands of Kenya to give a blend that is both strong and refreshing.

Perfect with a slice of buttery toast or a full English. What's your favourite breakfast? For many people it's bacon and eggs, with a slice or two of buttery toast. Non as essential, though, as a good cup of tea. This original blend is the perfect start to the day. They say breakfast's the most important meal. We say this tea's the most important drink. As the Original English Breakfast it carries Stephen Twinings signature, still working at Twinings, just as his ancestors did many years ago. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we'rea little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing. It is said that 7 is a lucky number, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that the quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. Ethical Tea Partnership. We care about the communities where our tea is grown and picked and this is why we are a founder member of the Ethical Tea Partnership, which works to improve tea workers' welfare and the environment in which they live. Twinings have also supported a range of projects since 2004, including improving health services and nutrition, providing access to clean water, better education and assisting children with disabilities. Together with our partners we have helped over half a million children in China and India. To find out more about our projects visit www.twinings.co.uk

Lerge leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Rich flavoured Assam teas have been combined with bright golden teas from the highlands of Kenya to give a blend that is both strong and refreshing.

Perfect with a slice of buttery toast or a full English. Decaffeinated original English breakfast. Our English Breakfast master blender searches relentlessly for the best teas from Assam, Ceylon and Kenya to give a perfectly balanced blend. We don't stop at just one tea from each origin, as each specially chosen tea garden adds a defining taste and quality to the end blend. Every cup you drink contains tea from 15 different tea gardens. The master blender has a busy task, the large number of tea gardens and seasonal fluctuations mean for every batch they juggle the levels of each tea in the recipe to give a consistently first class cup of tea. product.productName: Teapigs english breakfast 15 biodegradable tea temples -
product.productDescription: Great taste gold 2011. Rainforest Alliance certified. Everyday brew. What's special about this tea? Our signature blend, our daily cuppa, our builders brew, our Rosy Lee; call it whatever you want but our everyday brew is the ultimate British favourite. Three delicious teas: Assam, Ceylon and a Lovely Rwandan blended to give a balanced, malty, zesty alliance. Louise. Our tea temples: We use whole leaf only, not the dust found in regular tea bags; whole leaf is best. A tea worthy of worshipbelongs in a biodegradable""tea temple""- our spacious, silky, transparent purse allowing maximum room for perfect infusion. To support tea growing communities teapigs will donate 5p from the proceeds of this pack to the Noel Orphanage in Rwanda - discover more at www.teapigs.co.uk/noelorphanage

Rich&refreshing tea from our own Kenyan farms. Rainforest Alliance Certified. English Breakfast from Williamson Tea is a rich and refreshing black tea blend, specially grown on our own Kenya farms. It is 100% natural and we only use the finest tips, just the bud and the top two leaves. This full bodied tea can be enjoyed with milk at breakfast and throughout the day. Williamson Tea. Tea Farmers Since 1869. Williamson Tea is a family owned business with over 140 years of experience in the art of growing, selecting and blending fine teas. We care deeply about our tea and the people who grow it. All the tea in this pack is entirely grown using sustainable farming methods and we ensure all our people work in good conditions and earn a decent living. We are Fairtrade and Rainforest Alliance certified.

Whole leaf. A blend of African and Indian teas. The inspiration behind this blend... As the sun rises over the endless plains of the Serengeti and the elephants meander happily through the Barak Valley, tea leaves are picked high above, capturing their fresh flavour. Our master blenders have selected the highest quality whole leaf teas from Africa and India to create this beautifully golden tea. Let its refreshing taste transport you from the breakfast table to a land far, far away.

Riso Gallo have been milling and packing rice in Italy for over 140 years. Continuing their strong relationships with the rice farmers in the Po valley they have today been able to jointly cultivate organically grown Arborio rice to add to their already extensive range of rices for risotto.The Po valley became the renowned region it is today, because of the vision of a great Piedmontese statesman - Camillo Benso di Cavour.In 1855 he supervised the construction of thousands of miles of canals, thus irrigating one of the most fertile plains in Europe with water from the Alps. Using the same systems, Italian farmers, selected by Riso Gallo, continue to produce rice with the same unique characteristics to provide you with creamy and velvety wonderful risotto.ARBORIO is the most well known of the Italian Risotto rices.ORGANIC FARMING.

The Riso Gallo story . Begins in 1856 in Genoa with a man called Giovanni Battista, and today, some 155 years later, his direct descendants in the sixth generation are still running the business, now located in Robbio Lomellina. Riso Gallo produces rice in the Northern Po Valley, the only authentic risotto rice growing region and the single biggest rice growing area in Europe. ""Riserva 1856""- 1856 is the year in which our story began - this is the king of risotto rice by Riso Gallo, an exceptional quality rice with large, full-bodied grains that encompasses six generations of a passion and culture for rice. It originates from the Lombardy farmhouses, where the organoleptic characteristics of the land and the microclimate are at their most favourable. It is particularly popular with chefs due to the grains' capacity to retain a perfectly cooked""al dente""style, yet binds harmoniously with all ingredients, creating a perfect result. For recipes and further information www.risogallo.com. Follow us on Facebook. www.facebook.com/RisoGalloUK

Risotto Pronto from Riso Gallo is a range of delicious risottos, as only Italians know how. Because it is packed in protective atmosphere, preservatives are unnecessary. All you have to do is add water, bring to the boil, and simmer for 12 minutes to create a perfect Risotto - Pronto! The Riso Gallo story begins in 1856 in Genoa with a man called Giovanni Battista, and today, some 150 years later, his direct descendants in the sixth generation are still running the business, now located in Robbio Lomellina. Riso Gallo produces rice in the Northern Po Valley, the only authentic risotto rice growing region and the single biggest rice growing area in Europe. The interaction of climate, soil type, landscape and local workers, whose know how has been crafted by centuries of passion, ensure the uniqueness of Riso Gallo products. The Italian passion for food, with the use of natural and fresh ingredients, is recognised the world over. The dish of risotto embodies this approach, with the use of just rice, onions, a knob of butter, stock, and local fresh ingredients, being all you need for a complete meal, the perfect balance of creaminess and""al dente""texture. For recipes and further information www.risogallo.com

Carnaroli risotto rice

Ready in 17-19 min. Risotto is a traditional rice meal from the North of Italy. To get the perfect creamy and velvety consistence with the rice still retaining some bite,""al dente"", you need nothing but the best rice milled in the very best way. Vialone Nano: beloved by the Venetians. Its stubby grain makes it ideal for creamy Risottos and particularly for seafood. The Italians love it because: It is creamy and velvety. The rice retains some bite,""al dente"". It is versatile - you can easily create your own recipe for every occasion. The Riso Gallo story begins in 1856 in Genoa with a man called Giovanni Battista, and today, some 155 years later, his direct descendants in the sixth generation are still running the business, now located in Robbio Lomellina. The Italian passion for food, with the use of natural and fresh ingredients, is recognised the world over. The dish of risotto embodies this approach, with the use of just rice, onions, a knob of butter, stock, and local fresh ingredients, being all you need for a complete meal, the perfect balance of creaminess and""al dente""texture. Rice weeders, some of whom direct descendants still work for Riso Gallo today. Riso Gallo selected the best varieties, perfect for an excellent Risotto: Arborio, Carnaroli and Vialone Nano. For recipes and further information www.risogallo.co.uk

A great source of fibre. A gourmet meal in only 20 mins. Just add water! British spelt. Non GM. Minimum food miles. Environmentally friendly packaging. Vegetarian Society approved. Spelt Risotto with pumpkin&shallots. A delicious blend of pearled spelt with carefully sourced vegetables and herbs. A gourmet meal in just 20 minutes! What is Spelt? Spelt is an ancient grain, a distant cousin of wheat, but with a unique gluten structure making it easier to digest. It has a delicious nutty taste and spelt flour is perfect in all recipes where wheat flour is used... However, it's also fantastic as a rice replacement, as in this spelt risotto mix. During cooking the grains plump up to around twice their size and take on the full flavours of the additional ingredients. It's thought that Spelt originated in the Middle East, and since then has been much prized for its health properties: it's a great source of protein, is packed full of wonderful nutrients and is low in saturated fat. Speltis harvested with its tough outer husk intact, locking in all the goodness, and we only remove that when we come to clean the grain in our dedicated spelt mill. Check out our website for the full story! The History of Sharpham Park. For well over 1000 years, Sharpham Park has had a rich agricultural heritage, sustaining Abbots, Kings and Noblemen. Now the family home of Roger Saul, founder of the British designer brand Mulberry, the farm is set like a jewel in the heart of the rich, lush pastures of the Somerset Levels. The spelt fields have 6 metre margins and the hedgerows are only cut every other year, allowing wildlife such as hare, lapwing, dormice, bees and ladybirds to shelter and forage for food all year round. No pesticides, herbicides or harmful chemicals are used on any of the spelt grown on the farm. In partnership with... Bowel Cancer UK. Save lives. To donate www.bowelcanceruk.org.uk. Registered charity number (England and Wales) 1071038 Scottish charity number SC040914. Visit our website www.sharphampark.com. If you have enjoyed this spelt risotto, you might like to create your own using our Pearled Spelt and your own additional ingredients. There are loads of recipes on our website. Follow sharpham park on facebook and twitter

Still with the Earl's personal stamp of approval. Tea with the fragrant flavour of bergamot&lemon. ""There are few hours in life more agreeable than the hour dedicated to the ceremony known as afternoon tea""- Henry James. Some relationships come and go, but some are made to last. For years, Twinings has exclusively blended tea for the Earl Grey and his family - making it the only one with his personal stamp of approval. It's a relationship we're very proud of and why we think it makes afternoon tea with your family, friends and favourite cake so special. Tea, Twinings&Inspiration. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark an idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop on London's Strand. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man who loved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until it's just right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. If you like to drink yours without milk, why not try new Sunshine Grey? It's Earl Grey with a zesty splash of lemon. Discover something new with Twinings. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org. Working for a responsible tea industry.

Still with the Earl's personal stamp of approval. Tea with the fragrant flavour of bergamot&lemon. Earl Grey is one of the nation's favourite teas and its glorious history began here when it was gifted to the Georgian prime minister by a Chinese Mandarin. As the nights draw in and the festive gatherings begin, why not extend this act of giving with this delightful Earl Grey caddy, filled with your favourite tea, as a token of generosity... or you could always keep it for yourself!

Small leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Carefully selected China teas, lightly scented with natural Bergamot, provide the authentic Earl Grey taste: smooth with a subtle balance of flavours.

Zesty&aromatic tea from our own Kenyan farmsRainforest Alliance CertifiedEarly Grey from Williamson Tea is a zesty and aromatic tea. We use only the finest oil from Mediterranean Bergamot oranges, which we combine with fresh and bright black tea specially picked on our own Kenyan farms. It is 100% natural and we only use the finest tips, just the bud and the top two leaves. Still with the earl's personal stamp of approval. Tea with the fragrant flavour of bergamot. Some relationships come and go, but some are made to last. For years, Twinings has exclusively blended tea for the Earl Grey and his family - making it the only one with his personal stamp of approval. It's a relationship we're very proud of and why we think it makes afternoon tea with your family, friends and favourite cake so special. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing. It is said that 7 is a lucky number, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that the quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. We use the finest Darjeeling from the foothills of the Himalayas and add zesty bergamot citrus from sunny southern Italy, to create something altogether more elegant. The blue cornflowers? Bigger box better value. Still with the Earl's personal stamp of approval. Tea with the fragrant flavour of bergamot and lemon. ""There are few hours in life more agreeable than the hour dedicated to the ceremony known as afternoon tea""- Henry James. Some relationships come and go, but some are made to last. For years, Twinings has exclusively blended tea for the Earl Grey and his family - making it the only one with his personalstamp of approval. It's a relationship we're very proud of and why we think it makes afternoon tea with your family, friends and favourite cake so special. Tea, Twinings&Inspiration. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark and idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop on London's Strand. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man who loved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until it's just right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. Discover our new Earl Grey Family. The Earl Grey. Now it tastes of more bergamot and a squeeze of lemon which adds a little oomph of refreshment. We know the Earl approves, but we'd like to hear if you do too. So, let us know. Sunshine Grey®. Perfect with a splash of sunshine instead of milk. It's zingy lemon flavour inspires a wakey-wakey rise-and-shine feeling, even when you're just relaxing in the garden on a sunny afternoon. Lady Grey®. As for the bright, zesty orange flavour of Lady Grey, we think she's pretty perfect just as she is.

A natural source of antioxidants. Jasmine green tea. The Taste... Natural, Pure&Fragrant. Time is of the essence when it comes to creating our jasmine tea. These pretty white flowers are picked early in the day and layered with high quality green tea when the small petals are tightly closed. As night falls the petals open and release their light, perfumed floral fragrance into the tea giving it a delicate, refreshing taste. The Ingredients... In South West China, spring signals the harvesting of our green tea. It is stored until early summer when fresh jasmine flowers are in bloom. We choose this specific region for the distinct fragrance of the jasmine flowers grown here and the refreshing taste these bring to the tea. Our master blender is an expert in this intricate process and has a deep understanding of the region's sub tropical climate. It is a labour of love, working closely with the growers to consistently bring you the highest quality. Enjoy Twinings Green Teas as part of a balanced, varied diet and a healthy lifestyle. If you enjoyed this tea, why not try Pure Green Tea? Ethical Tea Partnership. product.productName: Twinings pure green tea 20 tea bags -
product.productDescription: A natural source of antioxidants. Pure green tea. The Taste... Natural, Pure&Refreshing. Springtime signals the first flush of our pure green tea. As dawn breaks and the dewy mist hangs in the air, the first buds and leaves are picked to lock in the fresh green flavour. Gentle sencha steaming and pan firing brings a light, toasty flavour to the tea, for a cleaner, more refreshing taste. Once given as a precious gift in China, let this gentle tasting blend be a gift from us to you. The Ingredients... Zhejiang province China, meaning""Crooked River""is the home of green tea and a home from home for our master blender. For over 3 centuries, we've been picking teas here, using only the bud and top two leaves, the best part of the plant. We then blend these together with the finest flushes from Asian origins for a fresher, punchier green tea. Our strong relationships and in-depth knowledge of the seasons across these origins means you always get the highest quality, handpicked tea at just the right time. A refreshing blend of green and black teas. A RICH SOURCE OF ANTI-OXIDANTS. COLOUR: Golden. STRENGTH: Medium. CHARACTER: A refreshing, traditional flavoured tea, which can be drunk with or without milk to suit taste. Twinings Green Tea Blend. Selected for their taste and quality, the green and black teas in Twinings Green Tea Blend offer the light refreshment of green tea coupled with the satisfying full flavour of black tea. Twinings Green Tea Blend can be drunk with or without milk to suit your personal taste. Tea and Antioxidants. Both black and green teas are naturally rich in flavonoids, which are also found in fruit and vegetables. These flavonoids are powerful antioxidants, which help protect the body from the harmful effects of free radicals. What is Green Tea? Both black and green teas come from the same plant, Camellia sinensis. Their difference in character derives from the method of processing; unlike black tea, green tea is not oxidised. Green teas have delicate flavour and are light in colour, whereas black teas produce stronger flavours and are deeper in colour. THE TWINING STORY. In 1706 Thomas Twining set up as a tea merchant in the London Strand. The firm has traded continuously ever since from the same address, an amazing and unique record. Now, as then, Twinings teas give the world unequalled pleasure and satisfaction. BY APPOINTMENT TO HER MAJESTY QUEEN ELIZABETH II TEA&COFFEE MERCHANTS R. TWINING&CO LTD. LONDON.

This coffee is suitable for any time of the day. The Rombouts Difference. Rombouts has been sourcing and roasting the finest coffee since 1896. We slowly roast our coffee beans for around 18 minutes. product.productName: Waitrose organic ground coffee Sumatra mandheling -
product.productDescription: Sumatra Mandheling coffee is grown on small plots in Takengon part of the Gayo mountain range in north western Sumatra and the name Mandheling comes from the name of the area and people who originally harvested the coffee. This coffee is traded whilst containing high humidity before being dried on patios in the sun . Top quality Arabicas have unique fully green/blush hue

These cherry coffee beans are grown in South West India and laid out in well ventilated structures to absorb the Monsoon winds that are full of moisture and allow the beans to swell to twice their size for up to 16 weeks and turn a pale golden colour. The beans are then hand sorted for final selection into AA grade.

A top AA graded coffee grown in the north and northwest of Narobi on high plateaus surrounding Mount Kenya and to the west along the Rift valley, at an altitude of between 1500 ./ 2100 metres. This climate produces 2 harvests per year in March and then October. Fermentation time ranges from 24 to 48 hours and graded by the Kenyan coffee board and then sold at fornightly auctions.

product.productName: Carte Noire ground coffee for filters & cafetieres -

product.productName: Bewley's panama fresh ground coffee medium/strong -
product.productDescription: Strength - medium/strong - 4. A rich coffee with full flavour and aroma. Suitable for all coffee machines. Resealable to keep your coffee fresh. 100% Arabica fresh ground coffee. Panama coffee. Grown at a perfect altitude on the slopes of the Baru volcano, Panama's coffee delivers a unique taste. Whilst a small coffee growing region, the use of older species of coffee trees produces beans with a flavor that is rich and full with taste. A History of Excellence. Founded in 1840, Bewley's is Ireland's original tea and coffee company. Ernest Bewley's passion for exploration led him to introduce our great tasting coffee to Ireland, and so began the long tradition of excellence and expertise that Bewley's is famous for. Our passion for coffee continues to this day. We travel the globe sourcing only the finest quality Arabica coffee beans so you can enjoy the perfect cup of coffee every time. So sit back, sip and enjoy! Patrick Bewley

This Javan coffee comes from 4 estates near the kawan Ljen volcano on the far eastern side of the island at an altitude of between 900/1500m. The crop is harvested between March and June and the area has been cultivated for coffee growing since early 1900

Daterra is a group of 4 coffee farms located in the Cerado region of Minas Gerias.Coffee is grown on 30 year old Catuai trees at an altitude of between 600 to 800 metres on the flat Savanna terrain. Daterra produces high quality green coffee beans with rigid inspections of cherries sorting size, maturity stage and density and after sun drying left to mature for up to 6 weeks.

Mainly grown on the eastern and western highlands of the Kwonggi Mountain range at altitudes of between 1300/1800m from small native farms and estates. The rich volcanic soil produces a harvest between April and September and the unique flavour character of spicey notes and winey accent. All coffees produced here are sold against a set grading system.
