product.productDescription: A characterful coffee, well balanced with flavours of toffee, fruit and cocoa flavours.

product.productName: from Waitrose limited selection ground coffee -
product.productDescription: From the Chanchamayo region of the South Western side of Peru where small communities harvest only the ripest coffee fruits. This ensures that the highest quality crops continue to flourish amongst the lush tropical forests that surround the growing areas.

product.productName: from Waitrose cup of excellence ground coffee -
product.productDescription: Cup of excellence is the most esteemed award given out for only the world's top coffees produced in a particular country for that year, bought in limited quantities at auction. The Martinez Mejia family run farm is part of a cooperative that produce this coffee at 1300 metres. The coffee is grown in curves under the shade of forest trees and harvested and dried at optimum ripeness.

product.productName: from Waitrose Tarrazu Mountain ground coffee -
product.productDescription: Tarrazu is a small valley region in Costa Rica which has rich volcanic soil. Coffee is grown up to 1700 meters and after picking the cherries are washed and sun dried before going to the mill. Produced by small farming cooperatives that have been cultivating since 1812

product.productName: Clydesdale Jamaica Blue Mountain roasted ground coffee beans -
product.productDescription: AUTHENTIC JAMAICAN.Clydesdale is a renowned coffee growing region within the world famous Jamaica Blue Mountains. It is nestled in the Grand Ridge which is home to Jamaica's largest National Park and Forest Reserve. Coffee from this area was first exported in the late 1700's and because of the exceptional quality of the beans, it has since remained an important growing region.The Clydesdale factory, although no longer in operation, still stands after more than two hundred years. Once a favorite getaway for honeymooners, the Clydesdale Great House along with the factory, has now been appointed by the Government of Jamaica as a National heritage site. This brand is well represented by exquisite coffees from this region creating the wonderful aromatic cup that established Jamaica Blue Mountain as the best in the World.PREMIUM JAMAICAN COFFEE.Many connoisseurs agree that JAMAICA BLUE MOUNTAIN®coffee is the world's best. An exquisite balance of aroma, body and acidity is the medley which makes JAMAICA BLUE MOUNTAIN®coffee very special. However, it is the mellow sweet aftertaste that separates this unique brand from all the others.GUARANTEE OF QUALITY.In 1953, the Jamaican Government created the Coffee Industry Board (CIB) of Jamaica, a regulatory body established to protect the quality of Jamaican coffee. Jamaica was the first country in the world to establish a defined geographical location designated to a specific coffee brand, JAMAICA BLUE MOUNTAIN®.Rigorous testing by highly trained CIB quality control experts ensure that all coffee exported under the Clydesdale brand meet the highest standards before being labelled JAMAICA BLUE MOUNTAIN®. The seal on the pack is the property of the CIB and is your guarantee of quality.

product.productName: Raw Bean Mexican ground coffee single origin -
product.productDescription: Strength - 3. A beautifully aromatic coffee. With a smooth and velvety body. Accented with floral and citrus flavours. Ideal for drinking all day. Mexican Terruño Nayarita reserva ground coffee. Raw Bean Philosophy: Coffee is at its best one week after roasting, that's why at Raw Bean we only roast our coffee once the order has been placed (even though it's more work for us, I know!). This ensures you get the freshest, most aromatic&best tasting coffee possible! We import the finest green beans (100% Arabica) from around the world and roast them using the latest technology combined with years of traditional experience to give you the perfect roast every time! Our Main Range: Raw Bean Single Origin Coffee. Blended coffees give consistency all year round, while single origins give originality. However, due to the nature of high quality single origin coffee, supplies are limited. This means that throughout the year we are continuously searching out coffees with distinctive and unique flavours. Here is one of our current favorites - enjoy the freshly roasted taste! Unwind, Laid-back Latino Fusion. A complex blend of Latin American coffees, offering an initial nutty sweetness which develops on the palate, rounding off with hints of caramel and toffee. We are continually tweaking the blend throughout the season to ensure you get the best freshness and quality in every cup. Raw Bean Single Origin Coffee Beans. These give you the same amazing flavour but allow you to grind them to the specification of your espresso machine.

So go on, pop the kettle on, settle down and start collecting for our perfect tea treats. Welcome to the PG tips Cuppa Club. Fully Rainforest Alliance certified tea. Pyramid tea bags. We created the ingeniously designed pyramid®bag because the unique shape gives the tea more room to move, freeing the delicious taste of the tea leaves, and giving you the perfect cuppa every time. So now you know. 100% natural. PG tips is the all natural drink that's made completely from tea leaves and nothing else. We pick the top two leaves and a bud known as the tips - hence the name - which is why we're so delicious. Go on... Why not try our PG tips Green tea range? Lemon Green Tea. Pure Green Tea. Do your bit. Have a cuppa. After two years working with our friends at Rainforest Alliance we are proud to say that the tea leaves in our pyramid bags are now fully certified. By choosing PG tips, together we are helping to protect the environment, whilst ensuring decent working conditions for our farmers and providing access to education and healthcare for them and their families. To find out more visit www.rainforest-alliance.org. Visit www.pgtips.co.uk for more information on PG tips.

product.productName: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire 160 tea bags -
product.productDescription: Rainforest Alliance certified. Bringing you a proper brew. We go to great lengths to make tea properly - from tasting 1000s of teas a day to find the best for our blend, to thinking about the water you'll brew it with at home. And over the years, we've built relationships with some of the world's top tea estates and gardens, visiting them in person as much as possible. But working closely with our suppliers is about more than quality tea. It's about trading with a conscience, doing business in a way that respects people and planet. By Appointment to HRH The Prince of Wales Suppliers of Beverages, Taylors of Harrogate North Yorkshire. Find out more at www.yorkshiretea.co.uk. We are a member of Ethical Tea Partnership. Rainforest Alliance Certified\u2122. Minimum 70% Certified Tea. This product includes teas from Rainforest Alliance Certified\u2122 farms. For more information, visit www.rainforest-alliance.org

Great taste gold 09. Sealed for freshness. Rainforest Alliance certified. Everyday teabags. Great taste gold 09. We are proud to have won a two gold star Great Taste Award. To win, a panel of experts taste and judge a range of products and we are delighted that they agree with us that Everyday tea is a great tasting cup of tea. Discover a brighter tasting tea\u2122. It's the small things that brighten your day - getting a seat on the train, having the door held open for you, hearing your favourite song... We've created our Everyday tea to give you more of those moments. With a bright, refreshing blend of fine tea leaves from around the world, we're sure each cup will put a smile on your face. Rainforest Alliance Certified. Minimum 30% certified content. We are working with the Rainforest Alliance to improve the lives of people who grow tea and the environment they live in. This is done by ensuring workers are paid a decent wage and have good working conditions. Tea estates also follow good farming practices, protecting forests, rivers, soil and wildlife. Our aim is to source 100% of our tea from Rainforest Alliance Certified\u2122 farms. For more info www.rainforest-alliance.org. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org working for a responsible tea industry. Forests are remarkable; they help to sustain plants, animals and the climate. To help protect these places, we choose to use wood from responsibly managed forests to make our cartons. What might surprise you is that even the wrap around the teabags (which looks like foil) is in fact made from wood pulp from sustainable sources. This means it is fully biodegradable, so pop it in your compost along with your used tea bags and in a few months you will have fertiliser to help grow your own veg. If home composting is not possible please dispose of in waste bin.

Natural, fair&Delicious. A big rich blend. I'm an award winning tea. Soil Association Organic Food Awards 2011 - Highly Commended. Unbleached bags of organic tea. A deliciously refreshing, rich and full-bodied blend of teas from the finest organic estates in India, East Africa&Sri Lanka. Clipper products are made with pure ingredients and a clear conscience. We use only the highest quality sources, add nothing artificial and strive to improve the welfare of the workers. No wonder clipper tastes so good. All our organic product are grown in a way that preserves the natural balance of the environment and will help sustain people, wildlife and the and for the future. Have you tired our green tea yet? We offer a wide range of speciality, fruit&herbal teas, as well as ground&instant coffees. Visit us at www.clipper-teas.com

Strong&mighty. Assam tea bags. Assam is a strong tea grown from our strong relationship with the North Eastern state of Assam, which dates back to when tea was first planted out by the Victorian pioneers. We still buy from the same high quality gardens, on the flood plains of the Great Brahmaputra. Only peak season teas are chosen to give the highest quality Assam tea. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing. It is said that 7 is a lucky number, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that the quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. If you like your tea to pack a strong punch, we think you'll also like Twinings Lapsang Souchong and Twinings 1706 Strong Breakfast. Discover something new with Twinings. Ethical Tea Partnership. We care about the communities where our tea is grown and picked and this is why we are a founder member of theEthical Tea Partnership, which works to improve tea workers' welfare and the environment in which they live. Twinings have also supported a range of projects since 2004, including improving health services and nutrition, providing access to clean water, better education and assisting children with disabilities. Together with our partners we have helped over half a million children in China and India. To find out more about projects visit www.twinings.co.uk. Elephants are a big part of everyday life in India... Just like tea. And although elephants aren't known for their tea drinking, in the tea-growing region of Assam they help out by doing a lot of the heavy lifting and carrying. We always think hard work deserves a cup of Assam. So sit back and think of elephants while enjoying this deep amber tea. It goes perfectly with brunch, or as an after-dinner alternative to coffee.

product.productName: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire hard water 160 tea bags -
product.productDescription: Makes a lovely cup of tea. Rainforest Alliance Certified - minimum 30% certified content. Tea bags. By Appointment to HRH The Prince of Wales Suppliers of Beverages, Taylors of Harrogate North Yorkshire. Rainforest Alliance Certified. Minimum 30% Certified Content. We're working with the Rainforest Alliance because they care about the things that have always mattered to us: that the farmers and their families are treated with respect, that their families are treated with respect, that their tea is grown sustainably and the environment is well looked after. www.rainforest-alliance.org. Something to read while the kettle's boiling... Blended to suit your water. If you live in a hard water area, it really affects the taste of your tea. That's why we make this special blend of teas that work brilliantly in hard water - and we're the only tea company who does this. Did you know? To find the best teas, our blenders taste hundreds of teas from around the world every single day. We care about trees. Twenty years ago, our chairman promised his children he'd find a way to plant a million trees. We asked you to help us, and together we've managed to plant over three million trees around the world. Now we're saving the forest. Deforestation is a major cause of climate change. That's why we've set out to save an area of rainforest the sizes of Yorkshire. To find out more about our Yorkshire Rainforest Project, visit yorkshiretea.co.uk. For every box of Yorkshire Tea sold we pledge to save a tree. Help us save the rainforest. Buy this tea and you'll save a tree. Simple. But you can do more by collecting these tokens. For every four you save, 50p goes to the Yorkshire Rainforest Project. Send your tokens to Yorkshire Tea, Admail 819, Harrogate HG1 1AZ. Friends of Yorkshire Tea. We get so many letters from people who love our tea, we decided to set up a little group on our website. If you'd like to join, take a look. Yorkshire Tea Gifts. Our gifts token scheme has ended, but the entire range is now available to buy on our website. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org working for a responsible tea industry.

product.productName: Essential Waitrose Original Blend Tea - 240 Round Bags -
product.productDescription: Our expert suppliers have carefully blended a selection of Kenyan and other fine teas from Fairtrade certified growers to give this tea its characteristic rich, refreshing flavour

Zesty, Orange&Bright. A pale golden tea infused with refreshing citrus flavours. Lady Grey was quite a beauty. She always looked elegant and liked to wear a peacock feather in her hair at social gatherings. The tea we named after her goes well at social gatherings too - even if it's just a pot of tea shared with a friend. Sit and chat, sip and gossip, and let the fresh, citrus flavour transport you to a sunnier place. Tea with fragrant flavour of orange, bergamot&lemon. Tea, Twinings&Inspiration. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark an idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop on London's Strand. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man who loved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until it's just right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. If you like to drink yours without milk, why not try new Sunshine Grey? It's Earl Grey with a zesty splash of lemon. Discover something new with Twinings. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org. working for a responsible tea industry

product.productName: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire gold 160 tea bags -
product.productDescription: Great taste gold 2010. Tea bags. Tea with friends. As every tea drinker knows, few things bring people together like a good brew. For us, that's just as true at the beginning of it all - in the gardens and estates where our teas are grown. The teas in our luxury blend come from quite a small number of suppliers (the world's very best when it comes to tea for tea bags, in fact) so over the years we've been able to visit them a lot. And because our tea buyers go in person, often even staying in our suppliers' homes, the relationships we've built are really strong. But, like a lot of friendships, what's really brought us together is a common purpose - producing the best tea we possibly can. Whether it's carefully cultivating the much loved malty flavour of the finest Assams, striving to perfect the wonderful brightness East African teas are famous for, or skilfully blending them together here in Harrogate, we all share a real commitment to quality. The result is a tea we love a great deal - and we hope you feel the same. By Appointment to HRH The Prince of Wales Suppliers of Beverages, Taylors of Harrogate North Yorkshire. Friends of Yorkshire Tea. We get so many letters from people who love our tea, we decided to set up a little group on our website. If you'd like to join, take a look. www.yorkshiretea.co.uk. Yorkshire Tea Gifts. Now available to buy on our website. We are a member of Ethical tea Partnership. Help us save the rainforest. By collecting these tokens you can help to save the rainforest. For every four you save, 50p goes to the Yorkshire Rainforest Project. Send your tokens to Yorkshire Tea, Admail 819, Harrotage HG1 1AZ.

Smokey&mysterious. Lapsang souchong tea bags. It was in the Qing era that Lapsang Souchong was born. The smoking of delicate tea leaves over pine fires began in the Wuyi Mountains; a small area with very limited supply. Today, this original home is still the unrivalled place to find the best Lapsang Souchong. The process is unique, as is the relationship between our master tasters and each grower, which ensures we still get the best quality and availability. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing. It is said that 7 is a luckynumber, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that the quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. If you like to drink yours intense, we think you'll also like Twinings Earl Grey. Discover something new with Twinings. Ethical Tea Partnership. We care about the communities where our tea is grown and picked and this is why we are a founder member of the Ethical Tea Partnership, which works to improve tea workers' welfare and the environment in which they live. Twinings have also supported a range of projects since 2004, including improving health services and nutrition, providing access to clean water, better education and assisting children with disabilities. Together with our partners we have helped over half a million children in China and India. To find out more about our projects visit www.twinings.co.uk. Here's a tea with a distinctive taste... We put it all down to the pine trees, it's the smoke from pinewood that drifts in and out and permeates the tea laid out on bamboo trays. We love it with biscuit or a piece of cake. But it's really up to you. Just enjoy its smokey flavour and golden colour whenever you feel in that mood.

product.productName: Taylors of Harrogate Yorkshire gold 80 tea bags -
product.productDescription: Rainforest Alliance Certified. Great taste 2013. Blend of 3 leaf origins from the top 10 tea gardens in the world. A great Yorkshire family business since 1886. Our Finest Blend. Here at Yorkshire we know that the best tea is about the best blend of leaves. And the finest blend we make is Yorkshire Gold. We choose teas from our three favourite origins - Assam for richness and body, Kenya for vibrancy, and Rwanda for its beautiful golden glow - and we buy them from the top ten tea gardens in the world. Back home in Yorkshire, our master blenders bring these luxury leaves together to make a rich, smooth and incredibly satisfying brew. Strong and mighty. Assam teabags. Assam is a strong tea grown from our strong relationship with the North Eastern state of Assam, which dates back to when tea was first planted out by the Victorian pioneers. We still buy from the same high quality gardens, on the flood plains of the Great Brahmaputra. Only peak season teas are chosen to give the highest quality Assam tea. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. What they don't know about their tea gardens and where to find the best quality, isn't worth knowing. It is said that 7 is a lucky number, for us it's the number of times the master blenders taste each batch to make sure that the quality from its exotic origin reaches your cup. If you like your tea to pack a strong punch, we think you'll also like Twinings Lapsang Souchong and Twinings 1706 Strong Breakfast. Discover something new with Twinings. Ethical Tea Partnership. We care about the communities where our tea is grown and picked and this is why we are a founder member of the Ethical Tea Partnership, which works to improve tea workers' welfare and the environment in which they live. Twinings have also supported a range of projects since 2004, including improving health services and nutrition, providing access to clean water, better education and assisting children with disabilities. Together with our partners we have helped over half a million children in China and India. To find out more about our projects visit www.twinings.co.uk. Elephants are a big part of everyday life in India... Just like tea. And although elephants aren't known for their tea drinking, in the tea-growing region of Assam they help out by doing a lot of the heavy lifting and carrying. We always think hard work deserves a cup of Assam. So sit back and think of elephants while enjoying this deep amber tea. It goes perfectly with brunch, or as an after-dinner alternative to coffee.

It was too long to wait between lunch and dinner... For Anna Maria, Duchess of Bedford back in the 1840s. She got so peckish one afternoon that she decided some toast and jam, served with a pot of tea would be a good idea. The trend caught on, and pretty soon afternoon tea had become an important part of the British day. Our Traditional Afternoon tea goes perfectly with sandwiches or cake, and is just right for when you need a little afternoon boost.

This hand plucked tea is then blended with the flavour of Indian spices for a sweet taste. Let each sip take you there... The journey from the tea garden to your cup... Chai was drunk only by the royalty in India. But they couldn't keep it to themselves for long. Soon the secret recipe spilled out of the palaces and into everyone's homes. Nowadays, the aromatic scent of cinnamon, ginger and cloves fills the air of every street in India.

Great British tea since 1903. Kosher. Natural Ingredient - This product is a delicious blend of the finestquality teas, and nothing else. Tea is a natural source of antioxidants. Since 1903 Ty.phoo has been uniting the country with taste by blending the world's finest teas. Morning, noon or night you can rely upon Ty.phoo to deliver you that great tea moment. So wherever you are, London, Cardiff, Edinburgh or Belfast, go on and enjoy a delicious cup of Ty.phoo - Great British Tea since 1903. In 1903, John Sumner first created Ty.phoo Tea for his sister, Mary Augusta, in his Birmingham shop. His simple aim was to make sure nothing got in the way of creating the best tasting tea at the very best value. In doing so he was able to put something back into the community. We still adopt the same values&beliefs today. Ty.phoo Sports for All - We've teamed up with the Federation of Disability Sport to develop the Ty.phoo Sports for All project. The project provides training to community sports club coaches, giving them the skills to include disabled people in their coaching sessions. The project gives many thousands of disabled people the opportunity to take part in the sports and games they love. Ty.phoo Quality Programme - Working in partnership with our chosen plantations, we're committed to continually improving the conditions of the people who grow, harvest and produce the tea. A rich, full-flavoured superior tea blend. Sealed for freshness. We believe our rich, full-flavoured blend delivers the best tasting tea you can put in your cup. So brighten up your day with..... For this Everyday blend, we select a range of the finest teas, including Assam to give body and a full flavour, while Kenyan leaves are used to deliver colour, brightness and freshness. Small leaf tea, specially selected and blended for Waitrose. Tea from the Himalayan foothills, where the slow growth of the tea bushes results in the famous Darjeeling flavour: delicate and highly distinctive.

Delicate&intriguing. Darjeeling tea bags. As the Darjeeling winter bids farewell and the last of the snow disappears from the peaks, this Golden Valleys' tea bushes burst into life. We choose first and second flush teas as they are the best of the season and give a unique, flowery Darjeeling character. Our master blenders pick and blend from only the best, small scale tea gardens, which guarantee excellent hand picking of just the bud and top leaf from bushes which are often over 100 years old. The journey from the tea garden to your cup... When it comes to tea we're a little different from everybody else. The way we buy and blend is unique; we choose from more origins than anyone else and have a master blender dedicated to each of these locations. Down through the Himalayas from Darjeeling on what looks like an antique toy train. Carrying its special cargo of tea, the tiny steam train winds its way around hills, through valleys. The tea is special because the growing conditions at high altitude give it a delicate and fresh taste and a shimmering gold colour. We love to drink it when there's an occasion - but we think tea drinking's an occasion anyway.

Zesty, Orange&Bright. A pale golden tea infused with refreshing citrus flavours. Lady Grey was quite a beauty. She always looked elegant and liked to wear a peacock feather in her hair at social gatherings. The tea we named after her goes well at social gatherings too - even if it's just a pot of tea shared with a friend. Sit and chat, sip and gossip, and let the fresh, citrus flavour transport you to a sunnier place. Tea with the fragrant flavour of orange, bergamot&lemon. Tea, Twinings&Inspiration. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark an idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop on London's Strand. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man wholoved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until it's just right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. If you like to drink yours without milk, why not try new Sunshine Grey? It's Earl Grey with a zesty splash of lemon. Discover something new with Twinings. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org working for a responsible tea industry

FAIRTRADE Guarantees®a better deal for Third World Producers. Fairtrade tea: premium quality teas have been sourced from Fairtrade certified growers, then carefully blended to create a tea with a bright, refreshing taste - perfect for every day. YOU CAN NEVER GET A CUP OF TEA LARGE ENOUGH... TO SUIT ME. C.S LEWIS. The FAIRTRADE Mark on this tea is your independent guarantee of socially responsible trade with farmers and workers in developing countries, enabling them to improve their standard of living. The price we pay for our tea includes an additional Fairtrade premium which can be used by the local community for educational, environmental, medical and social development projects. To achieve the perfect cup of tea for any occasion, three Fairtrade certified teas from around the world have been blended together. The Kenyan tea is grown by a cooperative group of smallholders, on the East of the Central Rift Valley. Here, lush, green tea farms cover the valley slopes, which yield a bright, coppery tea. The Assam tea has a full-bodied flavour, nurtured by the humid environment of the Brahmaputra Valley. The Ceylon tea has a more mellow flavour and is grown on the steep western Dimbula slopes of Sri Lanka, where the altitude and unique climate develop the tea's distinctive character. This carton is 100% recyclable and has been made entirely from sustainable forests. The teabags themselves are 100% biodegradable.

A refreshing and full flavoured blend of organically grown teas. FULL OF FLAVOUR NATURALLY. SOIL ASSOCIATION ORGANIC STANDARD. COLOUR: Deep amber gold. CHARACTER: Rich and full flavoured. Grown in a natural environment without the use of chemical fertilizers or pesticides, Twinings Organic Blend is a tea with a taste to really savour and enjoy. THE TWINING STORY. In 1706 Thomas Twining set up as a tea merchant in the London Strand. The firm has traded continuously ever since from the same address, an amazing and unique record. 5 different teas for 5 different moods. Enjoy a selection of 5 different teas for 5 different moments throughout your day: Why not wake up with English Breakfast? Hard work definitely deserves a break and cup of deep amber tea. Assam. Tropical Ceylon refreshes with every sip. Let Lady Grey's fresh, citrus flavour transport you to a sunnier place. Savour Earl Grey at the end of the day - it's as distinctive and delicious as ever. ENGLISH BREAKFAST. An invigorating amber coloured tea with a full-bodied taste. CEYLON . A refreshing amber tea with calming undertones. EARL GREY. A pale golden tea with the delicate flavour of bergamot. ASSAM. A deep amber tea with a rich and malty character. LADY GREY. A pale golden tea infused with refreshing citrus flavours. Discover something new with Twinings. TEA, TWININGS&INSPIRATION. For us, tea is more than just a drink. It's a way to calm down, to wake up, to spark an idea, to share a story. Our own story started in 1706. That's when Thomas Twining first set up shop. In the age of coffee shops, he was the man who loved tea and worked hard to bring it to the people. More than 300 years later, the passion's still there. Each tea - and we have more than 115 - is a special blend. They're tasted and tasted by our experts until they're just right. And we still sell tea from Thomas's little shop on London's Strand, so pop in for a visit. We'd love to see you there. Find out about our membership of: www.ethicalteapartnership.org. We care deeply about our tea and the people who grow it. All the tea in this pack is entirely grown using sustainable farming methods and we ensure all our people work in good conditions and earn a decent living. We are Fairtrade and Rainforest Alliance certified.

Organic. Gluten and wheat free. Registered with the Vegan Society. Suitable for coeliacs. Kosher. There's a common misconception that when it comes to delicious, gluten free cereals, real choice is often in short supply. Many moons ago that might well have been the case, but in today's more enlightened climate, our 'free-from' offerings come in every conceivable shape and style including hot and cold, younger and older, every day and every now and again. Nice and Nobbly\u2122 Granolas. Our latest offering consists of two lavish, Nice and Nobbly granolas. Oats have joined forces with scrumptious fruits, nuts and a generous sprinkle of organic care to create something that's deliciously decadent. We're a caring, family-owned company that's been making memorable, 'organic-only' breakfast cereals since 1985. Time enough to have learned a thing or two about avoiding anyartificial additives, especially when you're already using 'good for you' ingredients that have happily been grown in harmony with Mother Nature. We Care. Over the years we've learnt that environmental integrity comes in many shapes and sizes. Large projects like the adoption of wind turbines, the ongoing conversion of more farms to a happier organic outlook, free from synthetic pesticides and the use of recycled cardboard, and vegetable-base inks and less packaging shows genuine intent. However it's often our smaller, more personal projects that persuade 'real cereal' enthusiasts to sit up and take notice. Our original on-site organic garden still provides the most pertinent reminder of our simple, 'always insisting that we leave the soil better than we found it' philosophy, especially as our founder Arran still retains full composting duties. ""Always leave the soil better than you found it"". Rupert Stephens, father of Arran, the founder of Nature's Path. Twitter@naturespath

Our original on-site organic garden still provides the most pertinent reminder of our simple, 'always insisting that we leave the soil better than we found it' philosophy, especially as our founder Arran still retains full composting duties. ""Always leave the soil better than you found it"". Rupert Stephens, father of Arran, the founder of Nature's Path. Twitter@naturespath

Natural 100%. Fibre high. Trans fats 0g. GM free. Gluten free in accordance with EU regulation (EC) 41/2009. No artificial preservatives, flavours or colours. Suitable for vegans. Spirulina&ginseng defence boost - A chewy mix of almonds, oats and seeds. For further information about Bounce products please visit www.bouncefoods.com

Organic. Crunchy corn cereal. Whole grain. Gluten and wheat free. Registered with the Vegan Society. Suitablefor coeliacs. Kosher. Munch has been an invaluable member of the Nature's Path family for some while now. Year after year our little crunchy spheres of happiness have sat proudly in shopping baskets reminding us how just how well great taste and simplicity often go hand in hand. And yet, for all the deliciously crunchy contentment Munch provides, this was one cereal that simply wasn't prepared to sit on shelf and assume it had all the answers. New Whole Grain Recipe. Today Munch has even more appeal thanks to the creation of a new whole grain recipe, which means our great tasting corn balls are now more nutritious and well-rounded than ever before. Choco Munch. Better still, Munch also has company on shelf thanks to the arrival of its younger, more indulgent younger sibling, Choco Munch, which offers all the benefits of Munch but with the enticing addition of milk chocolate joy. We're a caring family-owned company that's been making memorable, 'organic-only' breakfast cereals since 1985. Time enough to have learned a thing or two about avoiding any artificial additives, especially when you're already using 'good for you' ingredients that have happily been grown in harmony with Mother Nature. ""Always leave the soil better than you found it."". Rupert Stephens, father of Arran, the founder of Nature's Path. The Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund®International. Spare a thought for our planet's largest primate, the endangered gorilla. With barely 100,000 of these magnificent creatures left in the shrinking rainforests of Central Africa it's vital that we lend our support to the Dian Fossey Gorilla Fund who work tirelessly to remind us what a poorer world we'd inhabit without our most noble of distant relatives. Fact: Human and gorilla DNA is 98%-99% identical! Local human poverty sits at the heart of the gorilla's heartbreaking plight. Our charity partner is wholeheartedly committed to gorilla conservation, resisting habitat destruction, tackling poaching, fostering orphans and educating locals about why they must stand up for their in peril neighbours. Every year 1% of Munch sales will be donated to the Dian Fossey Fund to help save gorillas. www.gorillafund.org. Twitter@naturespath

Handmade with coconut sourced from sunny tropical isles. Gluten, wheat, dairy free. GM free. Suitable for vegetarians. Delicious coconut bars made with sweetened flaked coconut and vanilla flavouring ...pure escapism to tropical isles in the sun. Here at Nature's Store we travel far and wide, from mountains in the clouds to islands in the sun searching for the finest quality ingredients to use in our products. Inspired by Nature's Store Cupboard we love creating exciting, delicious products that contain nothing artificial to take you on a wonderful taste adventure. These Nature's Store Coconut Bars are handmade with delicious creamy coconut that has been harvested from sunny Indonesian tropical islands. So sit back, relax, take a bite and drift away.... To see what other delicious products we have naturally source please visit www.natures-store.co.uk

Organic. Gluten free. Suitable for vegans. Kosher. Baked gluten free oats granola with almonds, pumpkin seeds, raisins and cinnamon. Sublime gluten-free granolas are just the latest chapter in our ongoing adventure to show that a 'free-from' diet needn't mean being excluded from mother nature's honest yet tantalizingly tasty ingredients. When thinking about which wholesome and environmentally responsible grains, seeds and fruits to include within our small batches of beautifully golden-baked wholegrain clusters, we avoid the temptation to simply opt for the easiest or most straight-forward option. We hope you agree that our crunchy, nobbly, clusters of golden baked oats go very nicely with the toasted pumpkin seeds, almonds, coconut, tangy cranberries and a pinch of cinnamon. Nature's Path is a friendly, family-owned, 'organic-only' cereal producer where words like taste and trust stand side by side. Although some might suggest that we're a little set in our ways, we believe it's only right to stay friends with the wider environment by always leaving the soil better than we found it. ""Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it."". - Ralph Waldo Emerson
